items.title: Railway stocks under FII scanner: RVNL, Texmaco among 5 seeing stake cuts in September quarter

items.title: Global borrowing in euros rises nearly 20% in 2025 to record high, Dealogic data shows
items.summary: Global borrowers are issuing a record amount of euro-denominated debt in 2025, a nearly 20% jump from last year, signaling a growing investor appetite for alternatives to the U.S. dollar. This surge, the third consecutive year of growth, also reflects lower interest rates, particularly for emerging markets. Despite this trend, the dollar remains the dominant currency for global borrowing.

items.title: PC Jewellers, PN Gadgil to Kalyan crash up to 45% — Why are jewellery stocks not glittering as bright as gold? Explained
items.summary: While gold prices remain on an upward trajectory—posing near-term volume headwinds—we remain constructive on the jewellery sector, underpinned by a sustained structural shift towards organised players, Choice Institutional Equities analysts said.

items.title: Incorporate green areas in projects, provide skill training to labourers: Shah to realty developers
items.summary: Amit Shah has called for green building norms to become standard in housing. Developers should build affordable homes and train laborers. Transparency in the land market is crucial, moving away from land banking. The RERA law has improved developer operations and protected homebuyers. Reduced GST rates on building materials will lower costs, allowing builders to offer more customer facilities.

items.title: Sebi to form working group on next technological frontier for stock exchanges
items.summary: India's market regulator Sebi is forming a working group. This group will explore the future of stock exchange technology for the next 5 to 10 years. It will also benchmark global best practices. The aim is to strengthen market infrastructure and investor protection. Sebi is taking a systemic view of technical glitches across exchanges to enhance market technology.

items.title: How India's poor went on a 'durable' shopping spree
items.summary: India's poorest households are now buying more durable goods like bikes, cars and fridges. Mobile phones are almost everywhere. This shows a narrowing gap between the rich and the poor in owning key assets. Spending on food has decreased as non-food items, especially durables, take up more of the budget. This shift reflects improved living standards across the country.

items.title: Finance Ministry invites suggestions from citizens for Union Budget 2026–27

items.title: Jaya Hind Industries to ramp up production at Tamil Nadu plant
items.summary: Jaya Hind Industries is expanding its Chennai manufacturing facility. The company is investing Rs 200 crore to set up advanced High Pressure Die Casting machines. This expansion will boost production capacity for internal combustion engine and electric vehicle components. The integrated unit will enhance the company's ability to deliver complex aluminium solutions. The facility will support a growing customer base.

items.title: GQG Partners’ India Portfolio: 4 stocks soar up to 40% in FY26, others struggle
items.summary: As of September 2025, the firm held stakes in 12 BSE-listed companies, with the portfolio valued at Rs 66,655 crore—a rise of 11% from Rs 60,221 crore in March 2025.

items.summary: Indian equity markets are likely to remain range-bound in the near term as investors await clearer signals on earnings recovery, the rupee’s trajectory and progress on the India–US trade deal, says Ashi Anand. items.title: Adani Group bets big on hospitality, prepares for big-ticket foray

About 15 hotels are planned in Navi Mumbai alone, highlighting the scale of the ambition and the group’s confidence in future demand for business travel, events and leisure stays in the region.

Correspondingly, the government of India has reported that the value of electronics exports during the same period has also increased from Rs 38,000 crore to more than Rs 3.27 lakh crore.

Despite recent weakness of around –15%, forward excess returns have historically been robust over 1-, 3-, and 5-year horizons. Discipline and patience remain key for investors seeking long-term trend-driven returns.

US Central Command described the operation, dubbed "Operation Hawkeye Strike," as a massive assault involving over 100 precision-guided munitions, directly responding to the attack near Palmyra.

items.title: IndiGo flight Status December 20: Check full list of cancelled flights from major Indian airports today
items.summary: IndiGo cancelled flights today: Due to the dense fog and low visibility, IndiGo flight operations have been affected across the country. Today too, the airline cancelled more than 80 flights from various airports due to adverse weather conditions. The airline has said that low visibility may impact flight operations in Ranchi, Jammu and Hindon. No flights were cancelled at Goa Airport and four IndiGo flights were cancelled at Ranchi Airport.

items.title: What does Infosys ADR stock rally on the NYSE mean for Infosys shares on the NSE, BSE?
items.summary: Infosys ADR stock price hit 52-week high on Friday, logging an intraday rise of over 56% after the short squeeze trigger

items.title: After the big foreign bet on Indian lenders this year, older private banks get on to the 2026 radar
items.summary: After a year of record foreign investments into Indian lenders, the question is whether older, mid-sized private sector banks will finally see meaningful global capital inflows in 2026. Mint got experts to list the variables before such investment decisions and which mid-tier lenders could win.

items.title: Verghese Kurien and the power of social entrepreneurship
items.summary: Verghese Kurien’s ambitions extended beyond dairy. Beginning 1979, he applied cooperative principles to oilseeds.

items.title: Three small-cap aerospace stocks to add to your 2026 watchlist
items.summary: These small-cap aerospace companies are building strong positions in electronics and precision manufacturing.

items.title: The week in charts: Exports rebound, tourism drag, nuclear shift, lower unemployment
items.summary: In this weekly Plain Facts compilation, we present to you data-based insights, with easy-to-read charts, to help you delve deeper into the stories reported by Mint in the week gone by.

items.title: From North to South, how revisions in MGNREGS will burden states
items.summary: The proposed revisions in the rural employment guarantee scheme place a greater financial onus on states. Their burden is expected to rise threefold.

items.title: AI has introduced a new lexicon of strange terms
items.summary: What is an algorithm-whisperer? What is vishing? Acquaint yourself with AI’s word salad.

items.title: Mint Explainer: How does the  ₹7,280-crore incentive package for rare earth magnets work?
items.summary: The Indian government's subsidy scheme to encourage the domestic production of rare earth magnets and counter China's export controls was notified this week. How will it work?

items.title: Bank holiday today: Are banks open or closed on 20 December? Is it a long weekend off in Sikkim? Check full list
items.summary: Bank holiday today: There are a total of 17 holidays for public and private banks in India in December 2025, according to the RBI's official state-wise calendar for 2025-26. Check the full list for this month here…

items.title: Goldman Sachs bets on gold for 2026, sees oil on slippery wicket
items.summary: Goldman Sachs predicts gold will reach a new record of $4,900 per ounce by 2026. This surge is driven by central bank purchases and anticipated interest rate cuts from the Fed. Conversely, crude oil is expected to remain weak due to a persistent surplus.

items.title: MUFG seals Rs 39,600 crore Shriram Finance deal, takes 20% stake
items.summary: Japan's MUFG Bank is allocating an impressive 39,620 crore to acquire a 20% stake in Shriram Finance. Dubbed the largest foreign direct investment in India's financial sector, this venture is set to fortify Shriram Finance's capital base and turbocharge its growth trajectory.

items.title: Indian travellers chase offbeat global destinations, Antarctica tops bucket lists
items.summary: Indian travellers are broadening their itineraries, venturing beyond the usual hotspots. The allure of Antarctic cruises is rising, drawing adventurous souls eager for the icy wilderness. South Korea is captivating wanderers, thanks to the global influence of K-dramas and its impressive ski slopes.

items.title: How an Indian CEO ran his first full marathon in a Swedish mine
items.summary: Hindustan Zinc's CEO Arun Misra ran his first full marathon in October—the world's deepest over a kilometer underground in a Swedish mine. Misra wanted to highlight modern mining practices and shift public perception of the industry and remind customers how integral mining is to everyday life.&nbsp;

items.title: TCS, Nasdaq vying for NCDEX equity platform vendor deal
items.summary: NCDEX is reviewing technical proposals from top global vendors for an equity platform launching in FY27. It has raised  ₹770 crore for financing and aims to entice IPO-bound firms, navigating a competitive landscape dominated by established exchanges.

items.title: Net direct tax kitty swells 8% on strong India Inc show
items.summary: Net direct tax collections have risen 8% to ₹17.05 lakh crore by December 17, driven by strong corporate tax payments and reduced refunds. While corporate earnings appear robust, experts suggest the government might miss its budgeted target due to a potential shortfall in income tax collection.

items.title: Despite US curbs, Rosneft supplies most Russian oil
items.summary: Rosneft continues to be India's top Russian crude oil supplier. Despite US sanctions, large volumes reached Reliance Industries, Indian Oil, and Nayara Energy in December. New Russian exporters have also emerged. Indian Oil was the biggest buyer, followed by Reliance Industries. These transactions are part of existing deals being concluded.

items.title: Altice USA Lenders Tap Sullivan & Cromwell for Antitrust Fight
items.summary: Altice USA lenders have tapped Sullivan & Cromwell to help fight a lawsuit which alleges they worked together to freeze the company out of the US credit market.

items.title: Korean Proxy Fight Threatens to Derail Trump’s Big Zinc Bet
items.summary: The Trump administration’s investment in a US zinc development has thrust it into the middle of a South Korean proxy fight, an example of how the government’s push for equity stakes in critical industries is facing free-market blowback.

items.title: Billionaire Salinas Faces $2.8 Billion Mexico Tax Claim Showdown
items.summary: Companies controlled by billionaire Ricardo Salinas Pliego will get a multibillion-dollar tax bill in January, and he will need to pay up or face consequences, Mexico’s President Claudia Sheinbaum said Friday.

items.title: Fatburger Owner Faces Allegations It Masked Liquidity Crunch
items.summary: One of FAT Brands Inc.’s shareholders is suing the restaurant-chain owner for allegedly hiding the true extent of its debt amid a darkening financial outlook that saw its stock hit a multiyear low this week.

items.title: 'Clear exit rules will encourage NPS participation': Finance Ministry
items.summary: New rules for the National Pension System offer more flexibility. Subscribers can now withdraw their entire pension wealth in a lump sum if it is ₹2 lakh or less. These changes aim to make the NPS more inclusive and responsive to subscriber needs. The amendments also provide clearer provisions for nominees and legal heirs.

items.title: PFRDA: Schemes on assured returns face clashing rules
items.summary: The Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority (PFRDA) in India is facing a daunting challenge in rolling out minimum return guarantee products. A conflict within the PFRDA Act complicates the launch of these vital offerings.

items.title: India & Oman will work to roll out trade pact in three months: Piyush Goyal
items.summary: India and Oman are set to implement a free trade agreement in the next three months. This pact allows Indian firms to employ 100% Indian staff for their investments in Oman. Oman offers zero-duty access on over 98% of its tariff lines for Indian exports. Indian businesses can invest in sectors like steel, energy, education, and healthcare in Oman.

items.title: Centre draws a price line to curb cheap pharma imports
items.summary: India has set a minimum import price for essential drug ingredients. The aim is to protect domestic manufacturers from aggressive pricing by Chinese companies. The restrictions will be in place until November 2026. Some experts worry this could increase medicine costs for patients. The government launched a scheme to boost local production and reduce reliance on China.

items.title: India-EU trade pact: Piyush Goyal to visit Brussels on January 8-9
items.summary: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal will visit Brussels next month for crucial trade talks. Negotiations for a proposed trade pact with the European Union are in their final stages. Both sides are working to bridge differences and conclude a comprehensive agreement soon. This pact aims to boost bilateral trade and cover 23 policy areas.

items.title: Singer’s Elliott Wins Ruling Forcing PE Firm to Wind Down Fund
items.summary: Paul Singer’s Elliott Investment Management Inc. convinced a judge to grant its request to liquidate an oil and gas fund as part of a legal fight with a Texas private equity firm managing the assets.

items.title: Adani Airport sees plenty of landing points in India now
items.summary: Adani Group is pausing its international airport plans. They will invest ₹1 lakh crore to expand their Indian airport business significantly in the next five to six years. This focus on domestic growth includes developing new airports and enhancing existing ones. The company aims for a potential listing of its airports business around 2030.

items.title: Piramal Finance to exit Shriram Life Insurance Company
items.summary: Piramal Finance is selling its 14.72% stake in Shriram Life Insurance to Sanlam Emerging Markets for ₹600 crore. This move aligns with Piramal's strategy to exit non-core assets and reinvest in its lending business. The transaction is expected to close by March 31, 2026, subject to regulatory approvals.

items.title: Piramal Finance to exit Shriram Life Insurance Company
items.summary: Piramal Finance is selling its 14.72% stake in Shriram Life Insurance to Sanlam Emerging Markets for ₹600 crore. This move aligns with Piramal's strategy to exit non-core assets and reinvest in its lending business. The transaction is expected to close by March 31, 2026, subject to regulatory approvals.

items.title: Russia's Sberbank allowed to import gold into India
items.summary: India has authorized Russia's Sberbank to import gold into the country. This inclusion is effective from June 25, 2025, until March 31, 2026. Sberbank joins Indian Overseas Bank and Union Bank of India on the list of gold importers for Fiscal Year 2026.

items.title: Reliance bets big on consumer business: RCPL’s authorised share capital hiked to Rs 10,000 crore to fund expansion
items.summary: Reliance Industries is boosting its consumer goods arm, Reliance Consumer Products. The company's authorized share capital has been expanded significantly. This move follows a business restructuring. Reliance aims to grow its FMCG business and challenge established players. The company is also investing in new factories and food parks. This strategic expansion signals a strong push into the consumer market.

items.title: World Gold Council India sees gold consumption down 12% this year
items.summary: India's gold consumption is projected to decrease this year due to a significant price increase. Despite this, consumers are still preferring lightweight gold jewellery. Investment demand remains robust, contrasting with a weaker jewellery segment. Higher prices are impacting affordability for many buyers. This trend is affecting smaller jewellers more than larger ones.

items.title: Vedanta Resources to raise $500-million loan
items.summary: Vedanta Resources is nearing a $500 million loan from global banks to refinance high-cost debt and fund capital expenditure at its Zambian copper mines. This move is part of a broader strategy to simplify its capital structure and reduce refinancing risks. The company has significantly cut its gross debt and extended bond maturities, diversifying funding sources to lower interest costs.

items.title: Tata Play gets time till February 3 to respond to Sony charge
items.summary: Tata Play has until February 3 to address allegations from Sony Pictures Networks India, which claims that Tata Play postponed providing essential data to an auditor. The matter is currently being evaluated by the Telecom Disputes Settlement and Appellate Tribunal.

items.title: Oppo Mobiles India disputes tax demand of ₹7,958 cr, pays ₹1,579 cr duty
items.summary: Oppo Mobiles India paid ₹1,579 crore in customs duty under protest in FY25 due to disputed classifications and valuations, with over a dozen ongoing inquiries from revenue authorities totaling ₹7,958.44 crore. Despite a 38% revenue drop and 56% profit fall, the company expects business improvement and is implementing cost-saving measures.

items.title: DoT receipts rise 47% during Apr-Nov on tariff hikes, licence fee payments
items.summary: The Department of Telecommunications (DoT) saw a 47% surge in collections, reaching ₹79,121 crore from April to November, driven by tariff hikes and normalized payment schedules. This robust revenue, coupled with a threefold increase in capital spending on BharatNet infrastructure, indicates the sector's operational health and accelerated execution of public digital initiatives.

items.title: Off-duty AI Express pilot assaults passenger at Delhi airport; suspended
items.summary: An Air India Express pilot faces suspension after an alleged physical assault on a passenger at Delhi airport. The incident occurred near the security area. The passenger reported the altercation on social media, sharing images of his injuries. The airline has launched an investigation into the employee's conduct. The pilot was traveling as a passenger on another airline.

items.title: Brookfield India REIT raises Rs 2,000 cr through sustainability-linked bonds
items.summary: Brookfield India Real Estate Trust has successfully raised Rs 2,000 crore via sustainability-linked bonds. The International Finance Corporation acted as an anchor investor. This follows a recent Rs 3,500 crore equity raise. These funds will support future growth and expansion plans. The REIT is also acquiring Ecoworld for Rs 13,125 crore. This marks significant capital raising for the company.

items.title: ED attaches Rs 7.93 crore assets in 1xBet probe; Yuvraj Singh, Robin Uthappa among celebrities named
items.summary: According to the ED, the attached properties belong to cricketers Yuvraj Singh and Robin Uthappa, actors Urvashi Rautela, Sonu Sood, Mimi Chakraborty, Ankush Hazra and Neha Sharma.

items.title: India to remove duties on key Omani energy goods under trade pact
items.summary: India will soon remove import duties on several Omani products. This is part of a new trade agreement, the CEPA, signed recently. Goods like crude oil, LNG, and urea will see duty cuts. The agreement aims to boost trade between the two nations. Implementation is expected within three months. This move will benefit both Indian consumers and Omani exporters.

items.title: Ather Energy enters auto insurance space to strengthen EV ownership ecosystem
items.summary: The new entity, which will operate as a Corporate Agent, will focus on offering auto insurance policies in partnership with multiple insurers for its customers across the country

items.title: Dense fog disrupts Delhi airport ops; 177 flights cancelled, over 500 delayed on Friday
items.summary: Dense fog severely impacted Delhi airport on Friday. Over 170 flights were cancelled and more than 500 faced delays. Airlines are offering refunds and rescheduling options. Airport authorities are providing passenger support. Flight operations are now reported as normal. This disruption affected both domestic and international services.

items.title: Sony takes majority control of Peanuts in deal with Canada’s WildBrain, Schulz family retains minority share
items.summary: Sony buys a majority stake in the 'Peanuts' comic for $457 million from Canada's WildBrain

items.title: China requests WTO consultations with India over ICT tariff, solar subsidies
items.summary: A Ministry of Commerce spokesman in Beijing stated that India’s measures violate several WTO obligations, including national treatment, and constitute prohibited import substitution subsidies

items.title: IHCL, GVK-Bhupal family redefine alliance from JV to long-term management arrangement
items.summary: Indian Hotels Company is shifting its partnership with the GVK-Bhupal family. The joint venture for Taj GVK Hotels and Resorts will now operate under long-term management contracts. This move aligns with IHCL's strategy to focus on capital-light growth. The GVK-Bhupal family will retain majority ownership. This transition aims to unlock capital for expansion and improve returns.

items.title: ‘Too low an inflation a cause for concern’
items.summary: Prevailing low inflation will squeeze profit margins, increase real value of debt and interest rates for private sector, says MPC’s external member

items.title: India, Netherlands set up joint trade, investment committee
items.summary: An MoU was inked in this regard between the two countries. The JTIC will serve as a dedicated mechanism to review bilateral trade relations, promote two-way investments, address investment and trade barriers, and explore collaboration in sectors of mutual interest.

items.title: Budget 2026: CII pitches lower import duties, 'trust-led' tax system, and more to Sitharaman & Co
items.summary: Union Budget 2026: The Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) has presented its economic roadmap to Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman.  Key proposals include reducing import duties on raw materials and industrial inputs.  CII also advocates for simplified customs procedures and faster digital clearances.  These measures aim to enhance domestic manufacturing and India's global competitiveness.  The industry body seeks a calibrated approach to tariff restructuring.

items.title: Railways failed to recover Rs 4,087 crore dues from private siding owners till March 2023: CAG
items.summary: Indian Railways has failed to recover over Rs 4000 crore from private siding owners. This outstanding amount includes land license fees. A CAG report highlighted issues with agreements and billing. The railways are urged to improve monitoring and implement IT solutions for timely recovery. This situation impacts railway finances and operational efficiency.

items.title: MUFG Bank to pick 20% stake in Shriram Finance for ₹39,618 crore
items.summary: Deal to bolster Shriram Finance’s credit rating, paves way for MUFG to gradually pick controlling stake

items.title: Parliament passes G RAM G Bill
items.summary: The Viksit Bharat – Guarantee for Rozgar and Ajeevika Mission (Gramin) or the Viksit Bharat – G RAM G Bill, 2025, seeks to establish a rural development framework aligned with the national vision of Viksit Bharat 2047

items.title: Concerns over slowing economic expansion in second half of fiscal led to 25 bps rate cut: RBI MPC minutes
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India's monetary policy committee decided on a 25 basis points repo rate cut. This move was driven by worries about economic growth slowing in the latter half of the fiscal year. Record low inflation provided the necessary room for this policy stimulus.  The decision aimed to support demand and economic growth.

items.title: SBI Chairman inaugurates Agri Robotics Lab at Telangana’s PJTAU
items.summary: PJTAU takes its first step towards unmanned farming

Infosys ADR zooms 40% in early deals on Friday

items.title: How GCCs are changing India’s commercial real estate market
items.summary: Global Capability Centres are significantly boosting India's office space demand. These centres are now hubs for innovation and core functions, not just cost savings. This trend is leading to expansion in major cities and emerging Tier-2 locations. Hybrid work models are also influencing office design, focusing on quality and flexibility. This shift is making office strategy a key boardroom discussion.

items.title: Cotton imports rise to meet domestic industry’s quality, supply requirements: Govt to Parliament
items.summary: US cotton imports have surged to meet domestic textile industry demands for quality and specialized varieties, bridging a significant supply-demand gap. This increase, even with a temporary duty exemption, aims to bolster India's export competitiveness without adversely affecting farmers, as MSP operations continue.

items.title: Power demand to rise 1.5-2% in FY26
items.summary: Demand also weakened during peak summers (April-June) as rains in early May 2025 cooled temperatures, leading to a lower requirement for energy

items.title: Infosys ADR trading halted on NYSE after 40% surge
items.summary: Infosys ADR Stock: The New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) has stopped halted the trading of Infosys' American Depository Receipts (ADRs) after it surged 40% to $26.62 on Friday, according to a CNBC-TV18 report.

items.title: Avadhut Sathe, academy get temporary SAT relief to start operations, access funds
items.summary: The Securities Appellate Tribunal granted interim relief to Avadhut Sathe Training Academy, allowing operations to continue and permitting limited fund access, while staying Sebi’s ex-parte order until the next hearing in January 2026.

items.title: Amit Shah calls for simplification of infrastructure, urban development rules
items.summary: Union Home Minister Amit Shah has called for the simplification of rules related to infrastructure and urban development.

items.title: India’s sale of urea sales jumps 20%, but that of DAP drops during Dec 1-12
items.summary: Centre says availability of urea, MoP, comples and SSP comfortable

RBI issues compounding order for FEMA violations by Nearbuy India Pvt. Ltd

items.summary: Grievances must be treated as as early warnings, says Ajay Seth

items.title: India’s financial services companies see record FDI flowing in
items.summary: Deals signal that global banks are increasingly prefer partnering with or acquiring scaled, well-governed NBFC platforms rather than pursuing capital-intensive and time-consuming greenfield banking licences in India.

items.title: Securities Markets Code to sharpen SEBI enforcement, shorten probes
items.summary: Single law to codify disgorgement, widen regulatory net and put timelines on investigations, say experts

items.title: Skanray bets on regional air connectivity with proposed Skanjet airline
items.summary: Skanray aims to enhance regional air connectivity with its proposed Skanjet airline, focusing on Mysuru’s growing travel demand.

items.title: Japan’s MUFG build on its over 130-year history in India
items.summary: Through its consolidated subsidiary MUFG Bank, it is buying a 20 per cent stake in Shriram Finance for $4.4 billion

items.title: US Fed's John Williams says there is no urgent need to cut rates again
items.summary: Federal Reserve President John Williams told CNBC on Friday he does ⁠not see an imminent need to follow last week's interest rate cut with another reduction in borrowing costs, adding that new inflation data is being buffeted by distortions.

items.title: Akasa Air to have 45 planes by next December
items.summary: Akasa Air aims to expand its fleet to 45 Boeing 737 Max aircraft by next December, enhancing operations and safety.

items.title: Nike's China conundrum deepens as turnaround stagnates, shares slump 13%
items.summary: Nike is running out of time to prove its China playbook works as its sixth straight quarterly decline in sales in the country underscores how a market once seen as a growth engine has become the biggest pressure point for the U.S. sportswear giant.

items.title: Benign inflation outlook to provide policy the space to support growth momentum: MPC minutes
items.summary: The Monetary Policy Committee has also decided to continue with the neutral stance.

items.title: CCI, Nasscom workshop focusses on AI’s impact on governance and competition
items.summary: CCI chief Ravneet Kaur emphasises on need for regulators to adopt AI

items.title: Piramal Consumer Healthcare aims to scale up revenues to $200 million by FY30
items.summary: It aims to grow  its power brands, including skincare brand Lacto Calamine and babycare brand Little’s, among others

items.title: Gold demand in India seen falling as prices surge, investment buying rises
items.summary: India’s gold consumption is projected to drop to 650–700 tonnes this year as a sharp price rally hurts jewellery demand. Investment buying remains strong, with consumers preferring lightweight 22-carat jewellery and bars despite record-high prices.

items.title: US stocks climb as markets hope for 'Santa Claus rally'
items.summary: Wall ‍Street's ​main indexes ⁠opened higher on Friday, as technology stocks ‌extended ‌their rebound from ‌an early-week selloff, while Nike tumbled after weak China sales ​weighed ​on its quarterly ‌results.

items.title: Gujarat’s Rabi sowing lags 3-yr avg by 18.5%; wheat, gram acreage declines
items.summary: According to data released by the Gujarat government, farmers have sown Rabi crops across 37.51 lakh hectares, marginally higher than the 37.14 lakh hectares recorded during the same period last year

items.title: ADB commits $4.26 billion in sovereign lending to India in 2025
items.summary: Nearly 32 per cent of ADB's 16 newly committed projects focus on the human and social development sector, followed by 26 per cent in the energy sector -- primarily advancing renewable energy -- and over 18 per cent in urban development, the multilateral development bank said in a statement on Friday.

items.title: Broker’s call: Leela Palaces (Buy)
items.summary: ICICI Securities

items.title: Listed firms' accountability not limited only to shareholders: SEBI Chairman
items.summary: SEBI Chairman TK Pandey has said that corporate governance acts as the foundation for the growth of the market.

items.title: Grape crop damage affects raisin exports from Maharashtra
items.summary: The damage has been most severe in Nashik and Sangli regions

items.title: Virohan raised ₹65 cr in Series B led by Mynavi Corporation, Blume Ventures
items.summary: The fresh capital will be used to accelerate Virohan’s path to profitability through product innovation, operational efficiencies and strategic hiring

items.title: Broker’s call: UltraTech Cement (Buy)
items.summary: PL Capital

items.title: SAT permits finfluencer Avadhut Sathe to operate trading academy; sets January 9 as next date of hearing
items.summary: The advisors were allowed to resume educational activities subject to the securities law

items.title: Oman allowed marble block exports to India under trade pact: Piyush Goyal
items.summary: India will now import marble blocks from Oman. This is a significant development under a new trade pact. The move aims to boost India's domestic marble processing industry. It will create jobs and reduce imports from Turkey. India's marble industry is estimated at Rs 40,000 crore. The agreement also facilitates mutual recognition of halal certification for meat exports.

items.title: Aircraft lessors had had enough of SpiceJet. How then is it flying?
items.summary: The airline is nearly operating as many wet-leases as those operational from its own fleet. It has also benefited from the market turbulence in early December due to IndiGo’s operational meltdown.

items.title: KRAFTON to establish India-focused fund of up to ₹6,000 cr with NAVER and Mirae Asset
items.summary: The Unicorn Growth Fund is currently preparing for establishment in January next year

items.title: RBI Board approves risk-based deposit insurance framework for banks
items.summary: “While the existing system is simple to understand and administer, it does not differentiate between banks based on their soundness. It is, therefore, proposed to introduce a Risk-Based Premium model,” says RBI

items.title: Uday Kotak lauds MUFG stake buy in Shriram Finance but flags big question on next move
items.summary: Uday Kotak welcomed MUFG Bank’s Rs 39,618 crore investment in Shriram Finance, questioning whether it should remain an NBFC or eventually seek a banking licence amid regulatory trade-offs and growth opportunities.

items.title: Forex reserves jump $1.68 bn to $688.94 billion
items.summary: For the week ended December 12, foreign currency assets, a major component of the reserves, increased by $906 million to $557.787 billion, according to the data

items.title: SAT lifts ban on Avadhut Sathe Trading Academy
items.summary: De-freezes bank account partially to meet operational expenses

items.title: Niraj Shirgaokar of Ugar Sugar Mills becomes new ISMA president
items.summary: Madhav Shriram becomes ISMA vice president

items.title: RBI’s central board approves risk-based deposit insurance framework for banks
items.summary: At present, the deposit insurance coverage is limited to ₹5 lakh per depositor of each insured bank. Deposit insurance cover increased from ₹1 lakh to ₹5 lakh with effect from February 4, 2020.

items.title: CCRI to release two new Arabica varieties
items.summary: New varieties are resistant to white stem borer, leaf rust and high yielding

items.title: ICICI Prudential MF files papers with SEBI for SIF
items.summary: Aims for long-term capital appreciation by investing in equity and equity-related instruments of companies outside the top 100 by market capitalisation

items.title: Buy defence shipbuilders Mazagon Dock, GRSE, Cochin Shipyard for up to 45% upside. Prabhudas explains why
items.summary: India’s defence shipbuilding sector is entering a long-term growth phase driven by policy support and manufacturing focus. Prabhudas Lilladher sees strong rerating potential in Mazagon Dock, Cochin Shipyard and GRSE after recent corrections.

items.title: Budget 2026-27: FICCI pushes for faster dispute resolution and procedural reforms
items.summary: Budget 2026-27: Industry body FICCI has urged the Union Budget 2026-27 to prioritise reducing tax litigation and streamlining compliance for businesses. Key recommendations include tackling the backlog of appeals before the CIT(A), simplifying TDS, and facilitating customs procedures to ease operational bottlenecks and enhance business competitiveness.

items.title: Adani group to commercially develop 240 acres at Navi Mumbai airport: Jeet Adani
items.summary: ‘Navi Mumbai airport can handle 20 million passengers, but the total demand is still higher. That is why we are starting the development of the second terminal at Navi Mumbai in the next six months’

items.title: As Bangladesh curbs jute exports to India, mills seek ban on seed shipments
items.summary: Raw jute prices soar to ₹1,10,000 a tonne from ₹60,000 in July

items.title: Markets snap four-day losing streak on global optimism, Rupee recovery
items.summary: Shriram Finance emerged as the top gainer among Nifty 50 constituents, surging 4.10% to close at ₹905.10, followed by Max Healthcare, which rose 2.62% to ₹1,076.00.

items.title: China requests WTO consultations with India over ICT tariff, solar subsidies
items.summary: China has approached the World Trade Organisation against India. The petition concerns tariffs on information and communication technology products. It also targets subsidies provided to India's solar sector. China claims these measures violate WTO rules. They allegedly provide unfair advantages to Indian industries. This is the second such petition from China this year.

items.title: Flipkart acquires majority stake in AI startup Minivet AI
items.summary: The IPO-bound company said that it has signed definitive agreements to acquire the majority stake, without revealing the deal size

items.title: India, Oman trade pact likely to be operationalised within three months: Goyal
items.summary: Under the Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement, Oman has offered zero-duty access on over 98 of its tariff lines or product categories, covering 99.38% of India's exports to the Gulf country

items.title: Nithin Kamath's warning to traders: Why poor position sizing can wipe you out
items.summary: Zerodha founder Nithin Kamath has warned traders that poor position sizing is one of the biggest causes of market losses. He said even traders who are right most of the time can be wiped out by a single oversized bet, stressing that risk management is critical for long-term survival.

items.title: External uncertainties pose risks to growth, speedy conclusion of trade talks present upside potential: RBI MPC minutes
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India's Monetary Policy Committee highlighted that concluding trade talks swiftly could bolster growth amidst ongoing external uncertainties. The MPC also revised India's GDP forecast for FY2025-26 upwards to 7.3%, signaling a positive outlook for the Indian economy.

items.title: CIAL hands over ₹79.82 crore gross dividend to Kerala Government
items.summary: CIAL recorded its highest revenue and profit in the company’s history with a total revenue of ₹1,142 crore and a net profit of ₹489.84 crore in FY25 and Kerala Govt is the largest shareholder in the company

items.title: Christmas holidays boost demand at Kochi tea auctions
items.summary: 96% out of the offered quantities of 6,94,660 kg in CTC dust was sold

items.title: India’s forex reserves jump $1.68 billion to $688.94 billion: RBI
items.summary: India's foreign exchange reserves saw a significant increase of $1.68 billion, reaching $688.94 billion. This growth was primarily driven by higher gold holdings and a modest rise in foreign currency assets. Gold reserves strengthened considerably, reflecting a diversification strategy. Special Drawing Rights and the IMF reserve position also saw slight upticks.

items.title: Shree Cement to set up a  ₹2,000 crore plant in Maharashtra

items.title: Watch: Explained: What are Supplementary Demands for Grants?
items.summary: Every Budget is presented in February and lays out the plan for the government’s spending in the financial year that will start in April that year. This relies on a fair bit of estimation. Once about 8-9 months are past, the government is in a much better state to have an accurate idea of how much it is going to spend in the year. So, in December, it submits what is known as a Supplementary Demand for Grants if it needs more money.

items.title: Scope for meaningful rate cuts going ahead: Neelkanth Mishra
items.summary: Credit Suisse' Neelkanth Mishra expects repo rate to fall to a decade low in the coming quarters. He says that beginning December the market may see a robust and widespread pick-up which may boost indices.

items.title: Tech up to a healthier world
items.summary: Sensors, 3D printed skin, wearables, reconstructed organs, revolutionized clinical trials, personalized medicine and what not – get ready for a new era of healthcare

items.title: Steel stocks rally as govt extends MIP on 66 steel products
items.summary: Stocks like Hindustan Zinc, Hindalco, Jindal Steel, JSW Steel and Tata Steel gained over 1 percent from previous close.

items.title: Endurance Technologies IPO opens: Should you subscribe?
items.summary: The Aurangabad-based company aims to mop up nearly Rs 1,162 crore (at higher end of price band) by diluting 17.5 percent stake through the issue that will close on October 7. It already raised Rs 348.52 crore through anchor investors' portion on Tuesday, the day before issue opening.

items.title: Cautiously optimistic on India; eyeing earnings revival: Sanger
items.summary: Global liquidity tailwinds are unlikely to get any better from now and that makes Arvind Sanger, Managing Partner at Geosphere Capital Management “cautiously optimistic” on the Indian markets.

items.title: Automation threatens 69% jobs in India: World Bank
items.summary: "In large parts of Africa, it is likely that technology could fundamentally disrupt this pattern. Research based on World Bank data has predicted that the proportion of jobs threatened in India by automation is 69 percent, in China it is 77 percent and in Ethiopia, the percentage of jobs threatened by automation is 85 percent," he said.
